New Records: Rohit Sharma scored 131 runs off 84 balls, the highest individual score in the match.
Rashid Khan took 2 wickets for 57 runs, the most economical bowling performance by a bowler in the match.
India won the match by 8 wickets, the first win for India in the World Cup 2023-24 series.
Key Match Events: Afghanistan won the toss and elected to bat first.
India scored 50 runs in 6.1 overs in the first powerplay.
Rohit Sharma became the first batsman to be dismissed by Rashid Khan in the match.
Rashid Khan took a crucial wicket of Rohit Sharma late in the innings.
Pre-Game Insights: Afghanistan elected to bat first after winning the toss.
The match was played at Arun Jaitley Stadium in front of 32,000 spectators.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma was named Player of the Match for his outstanding performance.
The win provided a significant morale boost to India ahead of the World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the 9th match of the World Cup 2023-24 series.
The match was a rain-interrupted game but played through all 50 overs.
The match saw several close calls and reviews, including the dismissal of Ibrahim Zadran and Rahmat Shah.
Others: The match was umpired by Michael Gough and Paul Reiffel with Marais Erasmus as the TV umpire.
The match was part of the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023-24, with India aiming to break their trophy drought.
